p: MEI offers two related concepts for capturing relations between bibliographic items. The model of relatedItem, as described in chapter of these Guidelines, is derived from MODS v3.4 (see documentationhere{:.linkref}). Its purpose in MEI is to encode bibliographic references between mostly "secondary" material, like reviews, articles, and so on. It may be used to provide cross-references between information encoded in different places of the header. However, relatedItem is less ideal for describing the relations between works, differing versions of these works, the sources in which those versions are transmitted, and where applicable the individual copies of a print. For these situations, it is strongly recommended to use the instead. This module is based on the Functional Requirements for Bibliographic Records, asspecified{:.linkref} by theIFLA{:.link_ref}. It allows a much finer description of relationships between such "primary" entities. For compatibility reasons, both models should not be confused or mixed under any circumstances.
